New Records: Ross Adair became the third Irish menâ€™s player to hit a T20I century after a brutal 100 from 58 balls, including nine sixes and five fours.
The partnership of 137 between Ross Adair and Mark Adair is Ireland's second-highest T20I partnership and their highest against South Africa in the format.
Key Match Events: Ireland's 137-run stand for the first wicket was their second-biggest T20I partnership.
Ross Adair's 100 was a standout performance with nine sixes and five fours.
The match was decided by a 10-run victory, a dramatic outcome after South Africa had performed well in the first game.
Pre-Game Insights: The victory tied the series after Ireland had lost the first game.
South Africa started strongly with 50 runs for the first wicket before Ireland's bowlers took control.
Post-Match Reflections: The win was seen as a significant achievement for Ireland, tying the series and showcasing their growing capabilities.
Players and the coach reflected on the team's resilience and progress in the format.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is part of a three-match ODI series, with the next game scheduled for the following day.
Others: The match summary detailed the scorecard, with Ireland scoring 195-6 and South Africa 185-9.
